channel.title: Data Analytics Portfolio on Helen Tong
channel.description: Recent content in Data Analytics Portfolio on Helen Tong

item.title: Kickstarting Your Project
item.description: This project uses machine learning to predict whether a Kickstarter campaign will meet its funding goal within 30 days of its launch. I started with basic campaign information from ~204,000 campaigns. As a baseline model, I optimized Logistic Regression, Random Forest Classifier, and Gradient Boost Classifier using GridsearchCV to reach the best model, achieving 75% accuracy. Next I used Pypeteer to scrape comments off of the Kickstarter website as an attempt to improve my model.

item.title: San Francisco Airbnb Listing Price Analysis
item.description: I ran a hypothesis test on all listings for San Francisco in 2019 - I wanted to find out if neighborhoods matter when it comes to Airbnb listings price. I ran Welch’s T-Test and Mann-Whitney U-Test to compare between two groups of nearby neighborhoods. Both Welch’s t-tests and Mann-Whitney U Tests return statistically significant results to indicate Airbnb listing prices do vary by neighborhoods in San Francisco, even if they are in close proximity.
